items.sentence: I thought Tom had paid Mary, but apparently I was wrong.
I thought Tom would be nervous, but he was very relaxed.
I thought it was a mistake to go talk to Tom about that.
Tom asked Mary if she was really happy with her new job.
Tom asked Mary some questions and she answered them all.
Tom asked me if I could go cycling with him on Saturday.
Tom assumed that Mary knew why John was in the hospital.
Tom didn\'t get a driver\'s license until he was thirty.
You\'d be amazed how often Tom doesn\'t do his homework.
Tom volunteered to help raise money for a new orphanage.
Tom will do whatever it takes to finish the job on time.
Tom doesn\'t know how long he\'ll have to wait for Mary.
Tom came into the restaurant and sat at his usual table.
Tom chose to live with his father instead of his mother.
Tom closed one of the doors and left the other one open.
I hope that Tom likes the present that I bought for him.
I think Tom can speak French. However, I could be wrong.
I was the one who convinced Tom to learn how to do that.
It seems like I\'m the only one here who\'s from Boston.
Tom was the only man at the company that Mary respected.
